answers.answer: My office does it routinely. I don't think I'm allowed to opt out cuz they need to know if I'm diabetic to care for my pregnancy
Its a smart idea to get it done. Technically you have the right to refuse any test but gestational diabetes doesn't always manifest symptoms yet can still cause serious problems.
I understand that completely.  But I've heard the liquid you drink isn't good for the baby? And it can make you feel sick?
Its not bad for the baby at all. It might make you feel a little sick at first buy that's normal from all the sugar. The same thing would happen of you ate a bunch of candy.
I would imagine it can't be harmful but every one has their opinion. I'm really petite and an sensitive to liquids. If I drink too much of anything I Gag and vomit. I'm dreading this test.

I can't stand the liquid and had to take it 3 times this pregnancy. I have a bad gag reflex and almost vomitted several times while doing them, but it was worth it I found out a few weeks ago I had gd :/ now all precautions are being taken for my lil one. If onlydecide to do it take a straw and go for the orange one in my opinion after trying all 3 I think it was the easiest. The strsw helps you go faster and swallow quicker in my opinion without tasting it as much

It's not like the most fun to do. I know if I tried to opt out my doc would say I would have to find another doctor because ultimately they have to be the ones to treat and handle your pregnancy and if they don't have all the info they would be risking complications that they weren't prepared for. I have issues when I fast I feel faint and nauseous then when I drink the drink it is kind of gross cuz it's a lot of sugar but out of all of pregnancy it isn't the hardest thing you'll  ever have to do. And gestational diabetes is hard to predict who will get it. It's not always from being overweight or an unhealthy eater. My best friend is a marathon runner and an annoyingly  perfect eat everything healthy freak lol. She has gestational diabetes this time around.

The drink is sugar water, it's completely safe for the baby. Opting out is, honestly, a very poor choice for both you and the baby. Gestational diabetes is a serious condition and if you should happen to have it and not know, it could cause major issues for both of you. I'm totally not trying to be rude, it's just such a simple thing to manage when you know you have it.

Actually look up the ingredients in the drink it's not just sugar water.  I took it.my first pregnancy and passed out from the drink. I refused it last time and I will refuse it again.my mom and father in law both have diabetes So I test myself once every two month with the finger prick eff that gd test

It's water, D-glucose (sugar), citric acid (a preservative), sodium benzodate (a preservative), and artificial flavoring. So yes, sugar water. Unless you're eating 100% out of your own, 100% natural grown garden, you are going to drink/eat WAY more "stuff" than that on a daily basis.
What the make you drink is like taking a 20 oz pop and adding 4 tablespoons of sugar. Doctor wouldn't give it to you if it would cause harm to the baby. Worried? Talk to your doctor about it.

I wonder if it's possible to just go ahead and eat a diabetic diet if you absolutely do not want to test? I've never had GD myself so I'm not sure what other hoops they have you jump through should you discover you have it
I never had the test in my first  pregnancy and haven't been offered one so far in this pregnancy

You should really take the test I just had mine last week and it wasn't bad ask if they have any different flavors you can drink I also had to get my tdap shot the same time which was way worse but you want to make sure you and your baby are ok
Thanks everyone for the input. I have 2 more days to decide.  I want what's best for my baby.
